name: Hello World
author: Graham Robertson
description: Hello World Chatbot Component. This is an example chatbot component for easy implmentation.

time_of_day.description: Depending on the current time, this value can be "morning", "afternoon", or "evening".

request.title: Exchange Body
request.description: Data to be sent with each POST equest.

user_input.description: Message sent to bot by the user.

context.description: Auxillary information used by the bot to determine appropriate responses. Only needs to be sent on the first request.

datetime.description:
Optional. Provide context for the time of day. Can be used in responses: "Good [time_of_day]!".

Where [time_of_day] has the values "morning", "afternoon", and "evening" depending on the time provided.

Defaults to current UTC time.

responses.description: Optional. Customise how the bot responds to each action in the component.

response.title: Exchange Response
response.description: Response and data sent back by the bot.

action.description: The name of the action performed.

confidence.description: The confidence that this is the appropriate response. Value lies between 0 and 1.

out_of_context.description: True if the bot receives input it feels was out of context. The bot has the ability to handle this but you might want to use this opportunity to intercept and do something else in your bot.

idontknow.description: True if the bot did not understand the user input. The bot has the ability to handle this (eg re-phrasing a question or instruction). However, you might wish to try and understand the input yourself and either switch to another component or append a reply to what this component will say next.

component_failed.description: True when the component is unable to complete its goal.

component_done.description: True when the component has successfully fulfilled its goal. This is a good time to check the updated_context.

updated_context.description: Any updated or new data from the bot.
